verses.verse: Give ear <WH238> to my prayer <WH8605>, O God <WH430>; and hide <WH5956> not yourself from my supplication <WH8467>.
Attend <WH7181> unto me <WH6030>, and hear me <WH7300>: I mourn in my complaint <WH7879>, and make a noise <WH1949>;

Because of the voice <WH6963> of the enemy <WH341>, because <WH6440> of the oppression <WH6125> of the wicked <WH7563>: for they cast <WH4131> iniquity <WH205> upon me <WH639>, and in wrath they hate me <WH7852>.
My heart <WH3820> is severely pained <WH2342> inside <WH7130> me <WH367>: and the terrors of death <WH4194> are fallen upon me <WH5307>.
Fearfulness <WH3374> and trembling <WH7461> are come <WH935> upon me <WH6427>, and horror has overwhelmed me <WH3680>.
And I said <WH559>, Oh that <WH5414> I had wings <WH83> like a dove <WH3123>! for then would I fly away <WH5774>, and be at rest <WH7931>.
Behold <WH5074>, then would I wander far off <WH7368>, and remain <WH3885> in the wilderness <WH4057>. Selah <WH5542>.
I would hasten <WH2363> my escape <WH4655> from the windy <WH7307> storm <WH5584> and whirlwind <WH5591>.
Destroy <WH1104>, O Lord <WH136>, and divide <WH6385> their tongues <WH3956>: for I have seen <WH7200> violence <WH2555> and strife <WH7379> in the city <WH5892>.
Day <WH3119> and night <WH3915> they go about <WH5437> it upon the walls <WH2346> there <WH205>: mischief also and sorrow <WH5999> are in the middle of it <WH7130>.
Wickedness <WH1942> is in the middle <WH7130> there <WH8496>: deceit and guile <WH4820> depart <WH4185> not from her streets <WH7339>.

For it was not a enemy <WH341> that reproached <WH2778> me <WH5375>; then I could have borne it <WH8130>: neither was it he that hated me that did magnify <WH1431> himself against me <WH5641>; then I would have hid myself from him:
But it was you <WH582>, a man my equal <WH6187>, my guide <WH441>, and my acquaintance <WH3045>.
We took sweet <WH4985> counsel <WH5475> together <WH3162>, and walked <WH1980> unto the house <WH1004> of God <WH430> in company <WH7285>.
Let death <WH4194> seize <WH5377> upon them <WH3381>, and let them go down quickly <WH2416> into hell <WH7585>: for wickedness <WH7451> is in their dwellings <WH4033>, and among them <WH7130>.
As for me <WH7121>, I will call upon God <WH430>; and the Lord <WH3068> shall save me <WH3467>.
Evening <WH6153>, and morning <WH1242>, and at noon <WH6672>, will I pray <WH7878>, and cry aloud <WH1993>: and he shall hear <WH8085> my voice <WH6963>.
He has delivered <WH6299> my soul <WH5315> in peace <WH7965> from the battle <WH7128> that was against me <WH7227>: for there were many with me.

God <WH410> shall hear <WH8085>, and afflict <WH6030> them <WH3427>, even he that stays of old <WH6924>. Selah <WH5542>. Because they have no changes <WH2487>, therefore they fear <WH3372> not God <WH430>.
He has put forth <WH7971> his hands <WH3027> against such as be at peace <WH7965> with him <WH2490>: he has broken his covenant <WH1285>.

The words of his mouth <WH6310> were smoother <WH2505> than butter <WH4260>, but war <WH7128> was in his heart <WH3820>: his words <WH1697> were softer <WH7401> than oil <WH8081>, yet were they drawn swords <WH6609>.
Cast <WH7993> your burden <WH3053> upon the Lord <WH3068>, and he shall sustain <WH3557> you <WH5769>: he shall never allow <WH5414> the righteous <WH6662> to be moved <WH4131>.

But you <WH430>, O God, shall bring them down <WH3381> into the pit <WH875> of destruction <WH7845>: bloody <WH1818> and deceitful <WH4820> men <WH582> shall not live out half <WH2673> their days <WH3117>; but I will trust in you <WH982>.
